meanings.definition: To apply a substance such as oil or grease to reduce friction
meanings.sent1: Dad used oil to lubricate the squeaky door hinge.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic will lubricate the car engine to keep it running smoothly.
meanings.sent3: The robot asked for a drop of oil to lubricate its joints.
meanings.sent4: The idea of teamwork can lubricate the process of problem-solving.
meanings.sent5: Remember to lubricate the bike chain before going for a ride.

meanings.definition: To make something smooth or slippery by applying a lubricant
meanings.sent1: She used lotion to lubricate her dry skin.
meanings.sent2: The skater lubricated the wheels of his skateboard for better performance.
meanings.sent3: The chef needed to lubricate the pan before cooking the eggs.
meanings.sent4: Laughter can lubricate social interactions and make them more enjoyable.
meanings.sent5: The rain helped lubricate the slide, making it faster and more fun for the kids.
